newsitem.title: USA: Bayer, GE Plastics set window venture.
newsitem.headline: Bayer, GE Plastics set window venture.

text.p: Bayer AG of Germany and GE Plastics, a unit of General Electric Co, said Monday they signed a letter of intent to establish a joint venture to make abrasion-resistant coated polycarbonate automobile windows.

Both companies will have 50 percent of the joint venture, which is expected to start up in the second half of 1997. Approximately $40 million has been earmarked for investment by the joint venture during the next few years, they added.
The new company, which has yet to be named, will be primarily based in the Detroit area.

The aim of the joint venture is to develop the materials, the abrasion-resistant coatings and process technologies required to enable the broad use of polycarbonate windows in advanced vehicle designs.
The companies made the announcement at the National Plastics Exposition being held here this week.
The technical and research and development efforts of both companies will be combined to develop a new polycarbonate window system having the abrasion resistance of glass.

The venture will build a development and engineering center, also to be located in Michigan, that will have the ability to manufacture more than one million polycarbonate windows for customer evaluation, the companies said. A development and marketing center, with its headquarters office in Germany, will also be established to serve Europe.
The joint-venture company will be represented by its own office in the Far East.
